gw.pl.logging

Class LoggerFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • gw.pl.logging.LoggerFactory
  • Deprecated. 
    keep using in Emerald and replace with org.slf4j.LoggerFactory in F.

    @Deprecated
public class LoggerFactory
extends java.lang.Object
    The LoggerFactory is used to initialize logging. Before any actual logging can occur the LoggerFactory needs to be configured.

      • configureDefault

        public static LoggerFactory configureDefault()
        Deprecated. 
        Configure a logger factory that logs to the console. If a logger factory is already configured, then return that one
        Returns:
        An instance of the configured LoggerFactory

      • configure

        public static LoggerFactory configure(java.io.File propFile)
        Deprecated. 
        Configure a logger factory from a properties file.
        Returns:
        An instance of the configured LoggerFactory

      • lockConfiguration

        public static void lockConfiguration()
        Deprecated. 
        This is a bit of a hack: external tools use this to prevent the normal server startup from clobbering the special logging settings used by the tools. After server startup, the configuration is unlocked and a more normal configuration is restored.

      • unlockConfiguration

        public static void unlockConfiguration()
        Deprecated.

      • getLogger

        public static Logger getLogger(java.lang.Class cls,
               java.lang.String subLevel)
        Deprecated. 
        Create a sublogger of a logger based on class name. A sublogger is just the sub-logger name appended to the logger name with a ".", like "logger.sublogger".
        Parameters:
        cls - classname
        subLevel - sublevel
        Returns:
        a sublogger
